1: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth
And the earth Was Without from, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
And God said, Let there be Light: and there was light.
And God saw the light that it was good: and God divided the light from darkness.
And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.
And God said, let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
And God made the firmament, and  divided the waters which were above the firmament: and  it was so.
And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.
And God said, let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
And God called the the dry land Earth; and  the gathering together of the waters called Seas: and God saw that it was good.
And God said let the earth bring forth grass, the  herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was good.
and the evening and the morning were the third day.
